channel.title: How i can check a active subscription in c++?
channel.description:
Hello guys, i have a question about keyauth subscription time check. So i need a code to check this in my cheatloader project..
thx for helping

item.title: How i can check a active subscription in c++?
item.dc:creator: Gru
item.description:
first you need to make sure you put

std::string tm_to_readable_time(tm ctx) {
char buffer[80];

strftime(buffer, sizeof(buffer), "%a %m/%d/%y %H:%M:%S %Z", &ctx);

return std::string(buffer);

}

static std::time_t string_to_timet(std::string timestamp) {
auto cv = strtol(timestamp.c_str(), NULL, 10); // long

return (time_t)cv;

}

static std::tm timet_to_tm(time_t timestamp) {
std::tm context;

localtime_s(&context, &timestamp);

return context;

}

at the top of your code but below all the includes, after that you should be able to use
std::cout << skCrypt("\n Subscription ends on: ") << tm_to_readable_time(timet_to_tm(string_to_timet(KeyAuthApp.data.expiry)));

right now i have it set to show how much time the user has left but you can adapt it to your use

this was just my solution not sure if it will work depending on how your trying to use it

Read full topic
item.source: How i can check a active subscription in c++?
